modul_1.penjelasan: Make a circle with your thumb and fingers, like forming the number zero.
The index finger stands up while the other fingers make a fist.
The index and middle fingers stand up, the other fingers make a fist.
Three fingers (thumb, index, and middle) stand up, while the ring finger and pinky bend down.
Four fingers (index to pinky) stand up while the thumb bends into the palm.
All fingers (thumb to pinky) open wide.
The index, middle, and ring fingers stand up. The thumb holds the pinky, which is bent down.
The thumb holds the ring finger down, while the index, middle, and pinky stand up.
The middle finger bends and touches the thumb, while the index, ring, and pinky stand up.
The thumb and index finger make a circle (like the number '9'), and the other three fingers point up.

modul_2.penjelasan: The fingers are curled into a fist, with the thumb resting on the side of the index finger, like a closed hand.
Four fingers (index, middle, ring, and pinky) stand straight up while the thumb bends across the palm.
The hand forms a curved shape like the letter 'C', with fingers and thumb curved toward each other.
The index finger points straight up while the other fingers curl into the palm.
The fingers bend into the palm while the thumb rests on top of the curled fingers.
The index finger and thumb touch to form a circle (like the 'OK' sign), while the other three fingers stand straight up.
The hand faces sideways, with the index finger pointing forward horizontally and the thumb aligned with it, like pointing sideways.
The index and middle fingers extend together pointing sideways, while the remaining fingers curl into the palm.
The hand forms a fist while the pinky finger stands straight up.
Start from the 'I' handshape (pinky up), then move the pinky to trace the shape of the letter 'J' in the air.
The index and middle fingers form a 'V' shape upward while the thumb touches between them.
The index finger points straight up and the thumb points outward, forming an 'L' shape, while other fingers curl inward.
The hand forms a fist with the thumb tucked under three fingers (index, middle, ring), while the pinky wraps outside.
Similar to the letter 'M', but the thumb is tucked under only two fingers (index and middle).
The fingers and thumb form a rounded shape like the letter 'O'.
Similar to 'K', but the hand tilts downwardâ€”index and middle fingers remain open as if pointing downward.
Similar to the letter 'G', but the hand points downward and the index finger points down.
The index and middle fingers cross each other while the other fingers curl into the palm.
The hand makes a fist with the thumb crossing over the front of the fingers (different from 'A', where the thumb is on the side).
The hand forms a fist with the thumb tucked between the index and middle finger.
The index and middle fingers extend together straight up, while the other fingers curl into the palm.
The index and middle fingers form a 'V' shape, slightly spread apart.
Three fingers (index, middle, ring) stand up forming a 'W', while the thumb and pinky curl inward.
The hand forms a fist while the index finger bends like a hooked claw.
The thumb and pinky extend outward while the three middle fingers curl inward (like a 'phone' gesture).
Use the index finger to trace the shape of the letter 'Z' in the air.
